bibl.title: Letter from Florence M. Read to Laura Armistead Carter, November 26, 1923

div1.p: Read expresses her relief that Henry Carter is out of the hospital.

div1.head: Letter from Florence M. Read to Laura Armistead Carter, November 26, 1923
div1.opener:
ADMINISTRATIVE STAFF
----
FREDERICK F. RUSSELL, M.D.
GENERAL DIRECTOR
JOHN A. FERRELL, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE UNITED STATES
VICTOR G. HEISER, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE EAST
H. H. HOWARD, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE WEST INDIES
MEMBERS
----
GEORGE E. VINCENT
CHAIRMAN
WALLACE BUTTRICK
DAVID L. EDSALL
SIMON FLEXNER
RAYMOND B. FOSDICK
EDWIN O. JORDAN
VERNON KELLOGG
T. MITCHELL PRUDDEN
JOHN D. ROCKEFELLER, JR.
WICKLIFFE ROSE
VICTOR C. VAUGHAN
WILLIAM H. WELCH
EDWIN R. EMBREE
SECRETARY
FLORENCE M. READ
ASSISTANT SECRETARY
INTERNATIONAL HEALTH BOARD
OF
THE ROCKEFELLER FOUNDATION
61 BROADWAY, NEW YORK
CABLE ADDRESS “INTERCOM”
November 26, 1923
My dear Miss Carter:
div1.p:
We are delighted to know that your father is
well enough to leave the hospital. Please tell him we
want him to be careful not to start to work too soon.
The history can wait!

Mr. Williamson tells me that a letter was
sent concerning the galley proof entitled “The Use of
Fish for Mosquito Control.” He is sending a duplicate
letter.

Doctor Russell writes that he expects to
reach New York on January second or third.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, Florence M. Read Miss Laura A. Carter
2121 California St., N.W.
Washington, D.C.
FMR:EP
